problems.title: Count Coprime Pairs
problems.description:
Two integers x and y are called coprime if gcd(x, y) = 1.
You are given an array of N positive integers. Your task is to count the number of pairs (i, j) such that 1 <= i < j <= N and gcd(ai, aj) = 1.

Input Format:
The first line contains a single integer N.
The second line contains N space-separated integers a1, a2, ..., aN.

Output Format:
Print a single integer, the number of coprime pairs in the array.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4
2 3 4 5

Sample Output
5

Explanation:
All pairs with gcd 1 are: (2,3), (2,5), (3,4), (3,5), (4,5).
hintsList: Use two loops over all pairs (i, j) with i < j, compute gcd(arr[i], arr[j]) using Euclid's algorithm, and count when gcd is 1. Optimize gcd to be fast.
